Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22858580]Gram-positive bacteria:B. subtilis KCTC1021 (MIC=0.4 µM), S. aureus RM4220 (MIC=4.7 µM), S. iniae FP5229 (MIC=0.9 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:E. coli D31 (MIC=0.2 µM), E. coli ML35p (MIC=1.4 µM), P. aeruginosa KCTC2004 (MIC=0.6 µM), S. flexneri KCTC2517 (MIC=0.7 µM), S. sonnei KCTC2009 (MIC=1.2 µM), A. hydrophila KCTC2358 (MIC=0.7 µM), V. parahemolyticus KCCM41664 (MIC=1.1 µM);Yeast:C. albicans KCTC7965 (MIC=9.4 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22858580]Non-hemolytic against human red blood cells up to 100 μg/mL
Sequence Information.Structure Description: According to the homology modeling, this peptide is composed of three secondary structural motifs including three α-helices and four β-strands separated by 7 loops regions.
Sequence Information.Function: cgUbiquitin shows broad potent antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive and -negative bacteria, without hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Purification and antimicrobial function of ubiquitin isolated from the gill of Pacific oyster, Crassostrea gigas.
Literature.Author: Seo JK, Lee MJ, Go HJ, Kim GD, Jeong HD, Nam BH, Park NG.
